alert.note: Alert for Elbert; Franklin; Habersham; Hart; Rabun; Stephens (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 18 at 3:29AM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...INCREASED FIRE DANGER IN EFFECT FROM 11 AM EDT THIS MORNING THROUGH THIS EVENING... Gusty winds will return across western North Carolina and northeast Georgia today. Gusts as high as 40 mph can be expected across the North Carolina mountains, with gusts ranging from from 20 to 30 mph across northeast Georgia and the North Carolina Foothills and Piedmont. Meanwhile, warm temperatures will combine with very dry air to produce relative humidity values ranging from 20 to 25 percent for all but the higher elevations of the North Carolina mountains where values of 30 to 35 percent will be more common. The dry air and gusty winds combined with dry vegetation will enhance the potential for fires to start and spread. Please refer to your local burn permitting authorities on whether you can burn today. If you do burn, use extreme caution since fires can quickly get out of hand under these conditions.

area.areaDesc: Elbert; Franklin; Habersham; Hart; Rabun; Stephens
